channel.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
channel.description: [url='https://www.teamfortress.com/loosecanon/13.html']Loose Canon Page 13[/url] There are three journal entries on the Life Extender page. One for Blutarch Mann, one for Redmond Mann, and one for someone else. In the comic with the Announcer (The Demoman Update), she appears to be hooked up to one like Blutarch's. Wat.

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Zeus
item.description:
Savant:

announcer goes into overtime - therefore she is immortal

:retard:
EDIT: Huddah huddah huddah, I are AGrunt.

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
Zeus:

How about speculating who else is immortalized by Mr. McConaghan’s machine?
It’s obviously Gordon Freeman. Why else would he wear a suit full of machinery?:freeman:

Mr. I don’t know what you just said to me. But fuck you!

lol jk I love you.

Read full topic

the thread really has no more purpose

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Spooboy

How does that relate to this thread at all?

I’m sorry? Seeing how you were wrong and the thread really has no more purpose I thought I would compliment the actor who does all the voices.

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: mechaelite
item.description:
gabefett:

many years before tf2 there were too brothers fighting over inhertitance, the is how the red vs blu fight started, but the assistant hellen looked just like the announcer, and the announcer’s name is also helen, altho several generations passed could helen still be alive? or just coul early helen be an acestor

have you thinked the ‘‘announcer’’ (A.K.A. Administrator) seen in the loose cannon comic could be her grandma, I mean look at dell and his grandfather, they are heavily simillar, the difference is that 1 has hair and the other doesn’t

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?

Zeus:

Loose Canon Page 13
There are three journal entries on the Life Extender page. One for Blutarch Mann, one for Redmond Mann, and one for someone else. In the comic with the Announcer (The Demoman Update), she appears to be hooked up to one like Blutarch’s.
Wat.

many years before tf2 there were too brothers fighting over inhertitance, the is how the red vs blu fight started, but the assistant hellen looked just like the announcer, and the announcer’s name is also helen, altho several generations passed could helen still be alive? or just coul early helen be an acestor

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Zeus
item.description:
Oops. Yeah, I just looked back too, she isn’t hooked up to anything. But I really wouldn’t be surprised if she had one of the life extenders.

It also looks like she’s the gal that convinces Dell (Engie)'s grandfather to build a machine for Redmond.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Probably is the Announcer. She seems to be the secret overlord who subtly controls everything throughout time.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 Announcer - Immortal?
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I looked at the demoman update and she doesn’t seem hooked up to anything; just seated at a switchbox. Nice noticing the third name at least; it could be someone else.
Announcer? Saxton Hale? Pyro? That guy from the Apple comic?

Read full topic
